quotes.quote: Life has no meaning. Each of us has meaning and we bring it to life. It is a waste to be asking the question when you are the answer.
Philosophers can debate the meaning of life, but you need a Lord who can declare the meaning of life.
Everyone now knows how to find the meaning of life within himself.
Each man must look to himself to teach him the meaning of life. It is not something discovered: it is something molded.
The meaning of life is to adventurously discover our gift. The purpose of life is joyfully share our gift with the world.
Whatever we are, whatever we make of ourselves, is all we will ever have - and that, in its profound simplicity, is the meaning of life.
The sole meaning of life is to serve humanity.
What's the meaning of life? Other people.
What is the essence of life? To serve others and to do good.
The purpose of life is a life of purpose.
Our prime purpose in this life is to help others. And if you can't help them, at least don't hurt them.
Life has meaning only if one barters it day by day for something other than itself.
The meaning of life is not an unquestionable answer; it is an unanswerable question.
There is only one meaning of life: the act of living itself.
The meaning of life is life.
Love is our true destiny. We do not find the meaning of life by ourselves alone-we find it with another.
Life is a fairy tale. Live it with wonder and amazement.
There is not one big cosmic meaning for all; there is only the meaning we each give to our life, an individual meaning, an individual plot, like an individual novel, a book for each person.
What is the meaning of life? To be happy and useful.
I ask of life to shine meaning in everyone who is searching.
The true meaning of life is to plant trees, under whose shade you do not expect to sit.
The meaning of Life is whatever we Choose.
Life has no meaning the moment you loose the illusion of being eternal.
Because if you've found meaning in your life, you don't want to go back. You want to go forward.
Purpose is what gives life a meaning.
The man who regards his own life and that of his fellow creatures as meaningless is not merely unfortunate but almost disqualified for life.
